column4: Hi. Little question. Do you see any 'advantage' using a the self-compiled fglrx driver?

there is no self compiled FGLRX driver.  If you install it yourself you compile the interface bit of it, but most of it is binary. Installing yourself can be the only way to get brand new versions.  Depends on how current a repository you can get for it I guess
But... For the radeon 9000 card that other guy has, the driver of the ubuntu repo should do... Don't you think?
I have an old radeon 9000 running here with the 'ubuntu-fglrx'. It works.
